intro: Euphrasia cambrica, commonly known as the Welsh eye, is a small, herbaceous annual plant native to western Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers with dark red spots. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and hedgerows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Euphrasia cambrica is often found in areas with rich, loamy soil and thrives in temperate climates.
